scenario_text.value: Ah! All of you are safe and sound, I see!

Jijimon! You and the little ones all
evacuated here?
They all seem to be in good shape, Takuma!
Yeah, thank goodness.
What in the world happened here, Jijimon?

It’s a long story...
But I suppose I have time to tell it.

About ten days ago, a thick fog the likes of
which I’d never seen came over the north sea.

We tried to go about our business as usual,
but the fog wouldn’t allow that.

Not only did the Master’s minions come out of
the fog, but a strange monster also appeared.
A monster?
Now, what was that girl named again...?
That girl...? You don’t mean Miyuki, do you?

Ah yes, that’s the one. The one that was with
all of you before.
What in heaven’s name happened to that child?

When we last met, she didn’t seem the type to
command monsters to run amok in the park...

Miyuki has been taken over...by that
“Master” thing.

The Master, you say...
Now it all comes together.

We were attacked at the school we used
as our base.

That...sounds about right. What the Master
seeks is neither you nor us.
...What do you mean?

This amusement park, that school. Both are
made from the memories of humans.

That’s why the Master wishes for their
destruction. Pathetic, really.
I’m afraid I don’t quite follow you...
Ignorance is bliss, as they say.

Why are all of you here, anyway? I’m sure it
was no easy feat to get here.
We want to save Miyuki.
...Well, now.

Miyuki is essential to us escaping from this
world.

So we came here to look for a way to return
her to normal.

Please, if you know any way to rescue her and
change her back, you have to tell us!

...That’s impossible, I’m afraid. There is no
way to oppose the Master. You’d best give up.
In this world, the Master determines all.
...And what about the four god beasts?
...Well, now.
It was inscribed on the wall of the shrine.

Oh, you mean the mural depicting those four
Kemonogami?!

Indeed. I was able to make some headway in my
investigation, thanks to Shuuji’s help.

I deciphered the mural, and came up with a
hypothesis...

The four god beasts needed to seal the Master
slumber somewhere.
They are the Four Holy Beasts.
It seems my judgement was sound.

Aye. This is proof that your world and ours
were originally a single world.
A single world...

Long before my birth, they were split in
two...and this world was thrown into chaos.

Before long, a will was born from the chaos—
the ego of the world, possessing great power.
That is the Master of this world.

But the Master is not all-knowing, and once
again the world was thrown into chaos.

The Four Holy Beasts exist to maintain
the Master.

What the heck’re you talking about?
I can’t follow at all.

Just be quiet and listen. There may be a clue
as to how to get home safely.
Yeah, uh, right...

So the power that supports the Master has
weakened, sending this world into disarray?

Not quite. I said they MAINTAIN the Master,
not support him.
They capture, restrain and suppress him.

Up to now they kept the Master sealed...
but their power has weakened.

Wait, what? Are you telling us to go meet
these Four Holy Beasts?
If you can, yes.
Whaddaya mean?

They may be found in the four directions of
the compass, as is told in your world.
But their exact locations are unknown.

Since I was born, not a single soul has
witnessed one of these beasts.

Damn!
We’re missing the most crucial piece...

Knock it off, would you, Ryo? Jijimon just
told us some important information.

But north, south, east and west... First we
have to figure out where that is, exactly.

Well, allow me to offer a piece of advice.
If I were the Master...

I would try to eliminate the Four Holy
Beasts that bind me to gain even more power.
So we’ll probably end up fighting, huh...

Yes, probably.
Does that frighten you?

What, you want me to say it sounds fun?
Of course it’s freakin’ scary!

But we’ll have to cross one or two dangerous
bridges if we want to get home.
We don’t really have a choice, now do we?
Hohoho, what a funny thing to say.

(The Four Holy Beasts... So they really
exist?)

(Now we have a way forward. We have to meet
them—to stop the Master, and save the world.)

(If we run into any enemies along the way,
we’ll just face them head-on like always.)

(Problem is, we don’t know what kind of
beings the Four Holy Beasts are...)
(What do I suggest we do?)
Go save the world.
Take out obstacles.
Be careful out there.
Go save the world.
We finally have a way to maybe save Miyuki.

To save the world, let’s find the Four
Holy Beasts!

Heheh, things have gotten crazy, but saving
the world’s got a pretty cool ring to it!

Yeah, we’ve got a job to do. We’ve got to do
the best we can!
Take out obstacles.

Doesn’t matter if we run into the Master.
We’ll take out anyone who gets in our way.

Obviously. We can’t let those punks just do
whatever they want!

If they come to us, that’ll just save us some
time. We’ll rescue Miyuki, together!
Yeah! Let’s save Miyuki!
Be careful out there.

The Master will definitely interfere, and we
don’t know what the Holy Beasts are like.
Be careful out there.

“Fight and run away, live to fight another
day.” That sorta thing?

Yeah, our lives come first! We have to keep
our guard up!

Whoa!
Is that an earthquake?!

No, not quite.
This doesn’t look good!

Oh, look, Takuma! Fog’s pouring in through
cracks in the wall!
GRAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAWR!!!
That voice! Miyuki?!

Oh no, we’ll be wiped out if this keeps up!
Run, everybody!
